conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the coil when the current is flowing in different directions.
Determine the force on the coil when the current is flowing in one direction: F = n I L B.
The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the coil, causing forces on each horizontal segment in opposite directions.
Net force on the coil is F_net = 2 n I L B, causing a torque.
Determine the force on the coil when the current is reversed: F_net' = -2 n I L B.
Relate the weight added to the magnetic force: m g l = 2 n I L B l.
Cancel l from both sides: m g = 2 n I L B.
Solve for B: B = m g / (2 n I L).
Final answer: The magnitude of the magnetic induction intensity B is (mg)/(2nIL).
